fields.Title: Last Mile Distribution Process: To-Be Workshop Report
fields.Outlet (if applicable): Submitted to Process Leads and Leadership of The Idaho Foodbank
fields.Description/Abstract:
This deliverable was one of several created for a process reengineering effort with The Idaho Foodbank. This technical report summarizes the work of the 3/11/21 To-Be workshop to create a map of the Last Mile Distribution process. The report contained the following contents:
1.  Introduction
2. Stakeholders, Success Criteria, and Prioritized Disconnects
3. Takeaways
4. Big Ideas—Major Initiatives Developed In the To-Be Session
5. Major Process Characteristics and Controls that Guide Crucial Activities
     * LMD Process Characteristics 
     * Process Controls
6. To-Be Process Diagrams and Detail Tables
     1. Level 1 Process Map: Overall LMD Model    12
     2. Level 2 Diagrams    13
          1.0 Recognize the Need (Partner agency communicated request or order, or internal order)    13
          2.0 Review Formal Order (Check Inventory & Ability to Fulfill)
          3.0 Pick and Pack Order
          4.0 Stage Order
          5.0 Process Paperwork (complete with product amount & weight)
          6.0 Load Truck
          7.0 Deliver and Receipt Order
          8.0 Return Food (optional)
          9.0 Return Truck & Submit Paperwork
APPENDIX
     * To-Be Workshop: Master Process-Disconnects-Solutions by Activity Table
